title: Define town.yml config schema
description:
Create Go structs for the town.yml configuration file in internal/config/town.go.

## Spec: town.yml

A Town is the workspace directory containing projects (rigs), agents, and configuration.

### Schema (v1)

```yaml
# town.yml - Bordertown workspace configuration
version: 1                    # Config schema version

# Core metadata
name: my-workspace            # Town name (required)
description: "..."            # What this workspace is for (optional)

# Workspace settings
rigs_dir: ./rigs              # Where rig repos live (default: ./rigs)

# Mayor (AI coordinator) settings - placeholder for future
mayor:
  model: claude-sonnet        # Default model for mayor
  
# Defaults for new rigs/agents - placeholder for future  
defaults:
  agent_model: claude-haiku   # Default model for polecats
```

### Go Struct

```go
type TownConfig struct {
    Version     int          `yaml:"version"`
    Name        string       `yaml:"name"`
    Description string       `yaml:"description,omitempty"`
    RigsDir     string       `yaml:"rigs_dir,omitempty"`
    Mayor       MayorConfig  `yaml:"mayor,omitempty"`
    Defaults    Defaults     `yaml:"defaults,omitempty"`
}

type MayorConfig struct {
    Model string `yaml:"model,omitempty"`
}

type Defaults struct {
    AgentModel string `yaml:"agent_model,omitempty"`
}
```

### Notes
- Keep minimal for now, expand later
- Use gopkg.in/yaml.v3 for parsing
- Default rigs_dir to "./rigs" if not specified
- Version field allows future schema migrations
